function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Workplace safety inspections are shown to reduce injury rates and costs, but the impact of OSHA guidelines on COVID-19 exposure risk is not specified.","Impact":"Uncertainty in the effectiveness of OSHA guidelines for reducing COVID-19 exposure risk in the construction industry.","Mitigation":"Conduct independent research to validate the effectiveness of OSHA guidelines for COVID-19 in construction, and implement additional measures if necessary.","Technologies":"Research studies, data analysis tools, and advanced safety equipment for COVID-19 mitigation.","People":"Workers in the construction industry, especially those in high and very high exposure risk categories.","Owner":"Employers, construction industry stakeholders, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Rapidly changing guidance from major agencies like CDC and OSHA may lead to confusion and implementation errors.","Impact":"Inconsistent or outdated safety practices that do not effectively mitigate COVID-19 exposure risk in construction operations.","Mitigation":"Regularly review and update safety practices based on the latest guidance from reliable sources, and provide ongoing training to ensure consistent implementation.","Technologies":"Digital platforms for real-time information updates, training software for remote instruction, and communication tools for disseminating guidance.","People":"Employers, safety managers, and workers involved in construction operations.","Owner":"Construction industry associations, government agencies, and safety training organizations."}]}
